page.title: 08Travel
page.content: Bildeston, Hitcham & Nedging Tye. Both old and young enjoy living in the friendly, peaceful environment Bildeston,Hitcham and Nedging Tye provide, although some think that there are too many pubs and the village could be tidier. Very few people would like to see any significant growth of the village, many fearing that small businesses would suffer. It is felt that greater use could be made of the village hall, particularly in the provision of leisure activities for the young and elderly. The majority of the villagers have become accustomed to the noise of R.A.F.Wattisham but some children complain about it interrupting concentration and sleep and interfering with the television. In general it is felt that the presence of the Camp is a necessary evil, attracting custom and
